page.title: 02 Stafford Castle.
page.content: In our block we have Stafford Castle.There have been archaeological excavations since 1978. The plan is to make an educational and recreational site.The archaeologist in charge runs the research programme. The buildings would have all been made of timber when first built in 1069.Over the next 250 years many of them would be rebuilt to make them more comfortable.In 1348 the castle was rebuilt in stone.In 1643 during the Civil War the castle was demolished by order of the Parlimentary Committee. It was 1800 when the Jemingham's rebuilt it in the new Gothic style on the Medieval walls.In 1950 the castle was abandoned due to deterioration.In 1961 Lord Stafford granted the castle and part of the inner bailey, a gift to Stafford Borough Council.In 1980 a visitors trail was opened.
